results.title: Oscars 2021 Quiz: Test Your Knowledge
results.abstract: Who was the first Black woman to win best actress? Who were the first Asian men to win best actor? Answer these 10 questions and see how you fare against other movie lovers.

results.title: Oscars 2021 Predictions: Who Will Win Best Picture, Actor and Actress?
results.abstract: Our expert is here to help you catch up to one of the strangest awards seasons on record. Here is what he thinks will win.

results.title: Why Is It So Hard to Show Black Women’s Musical Genius Onscreen?
results.abstract: Oscar-nominated performances this season put the emphasis on the trauma, not the artistry, of Billie Holiday and Ma Rainey. The most insightful movie might just be “Soul.”
des_facet: The United States vs Billie Holiday (Movie)

results.title: Overlooked No More: Bhanu Athaiya, Who Won India Its First Oscar

results.title: Mao Ayuth, Filmmaker Who Survived the Khmer Rouge, Dies at 76
results.abstract: At a time when most artists were killed, he hid his background. Later he resumed his career and served in government. He died of complications of Covid-19.

multimedia.caption: Mao Ayuth in 2017. His successful films included memories of his own childhood.

results.abstract: Lisa Rovner’s “Sisters With Transistors: Electronic Music’s Unsung Heroines” spotlights the pioneers who harnessed technology to do more than “push around dead white men’s notes.”

results.title: Oscars Prep: ‘Promising Young Woman’
results.abstract: The movie is a major Oscar player this year, clocking in with five nominations, including best picture and best director. Here’s why it’s on our radar.
results.byline: By Jenna Wortham and Wesley Morris

results.title: Monte Hellman, Cult Director of ‘Two-Lane Blacktop,’ Dies at 91
results.abstract: Originally part of Roger Corman’s army of hungry young actors and filmmakers, he made terse action movies and became a hero of the American independent film movement.

multimedia.caption: The filmmaker Monte Hellman in 2011 at the presentation of his “Road to Nowhere” at the Karlovy Vary International Film Festival in the Czech Republic.

results.title: Bradley Whitford Finds Inspiration in the Theater (and Dog Park)
results.abstract: The star of “The Handmaid’s Tale” talks about the magic sauce of Yo-Yo Ma and Aretha Franklin, and is ready to do some Ken Burns voice-overs.

results.title: ‘The Marijuana Conspiracy’ Review: Grass Fed
results.abstract: Five young women find that getting paid to get high isn’t quite as much fun as they imagined.

results.title: Richard Rush, Who Directed ‘The Stunt Man,’ Dies at 91
results.abstract: He was nominated for an Oscar for the movie, about filmmaking stunts, perception and reality. His earlier films were aimed at the teenage market.

results.title: With ‘Knives Out’ Deal, Netflix Signals It’s in the Franchise Business
results.abstract: The streaming gold rush of 2017-18, when Netflix scooped up big-name television creators, now seems to have migrated to the film world.

results.title: The Oscars Are a Week Away, but How Many Will Watch?
results.abstract: TV ratings for awards shows have been in free fall, especially during the pandemic, and Hollywood doesn’t want the viewing public to toss its premier showcase into the entertainment dustbin.
results.byline: By Nicole Sperling and Brooks Barnes
